<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Reflective Ripple Stance](/Feats.aspx?ID=2980) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=112" />
<trait label="Stance" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=152" />
<trait label="Water" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=165" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 202 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Requirements**
You're unarmored.

</column>

---

You enter a stance of fluid grace as small amounts of water flow with your movements and attacks. You can make flowing wave attacks that deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage. They are in the [brawling](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=4) group and have the [agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [disarm](/Traits.aspx?ID=175), [finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196), [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199), and [water](/Traits.aspx?ID=165) traits.

 While in Reflective Ripple Stance, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) checks to [Disarm](/Actions.aspx?ID=41), [Swim](/Actions.aspx?ID=39), or [Trip](/Actions.aspx?ID=40), and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your Reflex DC to avoid being Disarmed and Tripped.

**Special** This feat gains your choice of either the [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48) or [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120) trait, matching your ki spell tradition if possible.

<title level="2">Reflective Ripple Stance leads to...</title>
[Rippling Spin](/Feats.aspx?ID=2983), [Wave Spiral](/Feats.aspx?ID=2985)
name: Reflective Ripple Stance
